lead_paragraph: SMITH--Howard. The board and staff of United Hospital Fund are deeply saddened by the death of our chairman emeritus, a health care visionary and dedicated civic and business leader. Over six decades, Howard passionately championed innovations in hospital care and community health that are now understood broadly as essential to health reform. His ability to see opportunity and make important and timely decisions, was anchored by his deep belief in the imperative of community service. UHF benefited enormously from his skillful and steadfast leadership as our wise and caring chairman for 17 years and almost 40 years of active engagement on our board. He leaves an enduring legacy in health care and an indelible mark on his beloved Brooklyn and UHF. We extend our deepest sympathies to his children and remember with affection his wife, Rev. Elsie Smith, who shared and extended his commitment and dedication. J. Barclay Collins II Chairman James R. Tallon, Jr. President 1/3
